paper_abstract: Weng et al. introduced the notion of conditional proxy re-encryption (C-PRE), whereby only the ciphertext satisfying one condition set by Alice can be re-encrypted by the proxy. To achieve more fine-grained delegation on the condition set, we introduce a new cryptographic primitive called fuzzy conditional proxy re-encryption (FC-PRE) in which we view conditions in C-PRE as a set of descriptive keywords. A FC-PRE scheme allows for a proxy with the re-encryption key for a conditional keyword set, W, to re-encrypt a ciphertext encrypted with a conditional keyword set, W', if and only if W' and W' are close to each other as measured by the "set overlap" distance metric. Therefore, our system allows a certain amount of error-tolerance in the conditions. We formalize the FC-PRE security model by incorporating the advantages in previous C-PRE. Finally, we present an efficient construction of FC-PRE scheme, and prove its CCA-security under the well-studied decisional bilinear Diffie-Hellman (DED1-1) assumption in the random oracle model.
